item.title: Denise add a quote by virginia woolf
item.description: "As a woman I have no country. As a woman I want no country. As a woman, my country is the whole world." -- virginia woolf

item.title: Denise add a quote by Frank Zappa
item.description: "So many books, so little time." -- Frank Zappa

item.title: Denise add a quote by Albert Camus
item.description: "Don't walk behind me; I may not lead. Don't walk in front of me; I may not follow. Just walk beside me and be my friend." -- Albert Camus

item.title: Denise add a quote by Miss Piggy
item.description: "Beauty is in the eye of the beholder and it may be necessary from time to time to give a stupid or misinformed beholder a black eye." -- Miss Piggy

item.title: Denise add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "A woman is like a tea bag; you never know how strong it is until it's in hot water." -- Eleanor Roosevelt

item.title: Denise add a quote by George Bernard Shaw
item.description: "Animals are my friends...and I don't eat my friends." -- George Bernard Shaw

item.title: Denise add a quote by Anais Nin
item.description: "Love never dies a natural death. It dies because we don't know how to replenish its source. It dies of blindness and errors and betrayals. It dies of illness and wounds; it dies of weariness, of witherings, of tarnishings." -- Anais Nin

item.title: Denise add a quote by Rainer Maria Rilke
item.description: "Perhaps all the dragons in our lives are princesses who are only waiting to see us act, just once, with beauty and courage. Perhaps everything that frightens us is, in its deepest essence, something helpless that wants our love." -- Rainer Maria Rilke

item.title: Denise add a quote by David Sedaris
item.description: "If you're looking for sympathy you'll find it between shit and syphilis in the dictionary." -- David Sedaris

item.title: Denise add a quote by David Byrne
item.description: "Sometimes it's a form of love just to talk to somebody that you have nothing in common with and still be fascinated by their presence." -- David Byrne

item.title: Denise add a quote by Haruki Murakami
item.description: "Eleven o'clock had come and gone. I had to find a way to bring this conversation to a successful conclusion and get out of there. But before I could say anything, she suddenly asked me to hold her. 'Why?' I asked, caught off guard. 'To charge my batteries,' she said. 'Charge your batteries?' 'My body has run out of electricity. I haven't been able to sleep for days now. The minute I get to sleep I wake up, and then I can't get back to sleep. I can't think. When I get like that, somebody has to charge my batteries. Otherwise, I can't go on living. It's true.' I peered into her eyes, wondering if she was still drunk, but they were once again her usual cool, intelligent eyes. She was far from drunk." -- Haruki Murakami

item.title: Denise add a quote by Douglas Coupland
item.description: "Remember: the time you feel lonely is the time you most need to be by yourself. Life's cruelest irony." -- Douglas Coupland

item.title: Denise add a quote by Carson McCullers
item.description: "Maybe when people longed for a thing that bad the longing made them trust in anything that might give it to them." -- Carson McCullers
